|cpu1_cores = 1 |cpu1_type = MIPS |cpu1_type_rev = BMIPS3300 (R1) |cpu1spd = 240 |is_doc = |bus = |flash1type = |fla1_num = |fla1chip = |flash1size = 2 |flash1maxsize = |ram1type = |ram1type1 = |ram1spd = |ram1size = 8 |ram1chip = |ram1_num = |nvramsize = |eth_cpu = true |sw_cpu = true |wan_ports = 1 |wan_speed = 100MbE |lan_ports = 4 |lan_speed = 100MbE |ethstandard = |portbasedvlan = |802.1qvlan = |auto_mdix = |sup_jumbo = |ethoui = |oui = |bootwait = |stockbootloader = |stockos = |exp_if_types = |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 12 |pwr_amp_dc = 0.5 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = |pwr_barrel_inner = |pwr_barrel_len = |pwr_pol = |serial = yes |jtag = yes |specialfeat = |flags = |addchip = |802dot11_protocols = bg |defaulip = |defaultlogin = |defaultpass = |defaultssid = |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = |manuf = CyberTAN |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = DD-WRT |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 02/09/2007 |estreldate = |estprice = |upc = 745883582129 |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = B000XDQK2G |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = |buttons = |led = |dimensions = |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1cpu = true |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = RP-TNC |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 |rad1correv = 13 |rad1cap = }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "3763-14141304R" is silkscreened on the board. ==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Flashing dd-wrt=== Supported by dd-wrt as of = v24 micro rc7 - 9063 Thanks to Eko for getting the device supported.
Special thanks to a9988cd for donation, Tornado and redhawk0 for all the work and testing.
'''Don't use this image on any other router - for WRH54G only !''' Linksys WRH54G is now supported by dd-wrt. No need to replace cfe, but you alwayays need to use special firmware built for wrh54g only. Even for later GUI upgrades. # Restore to defaults # Open upgrade page, select [ftp://dd-wrt.com/others/eko/V24_TNG/svn12548/dd-wrt.v24-12548_WRH54G_micro.bin dd-wrt.v24-12548_WRH54G_micro.bin] (or other special wrh image) # Upgrade # When it comes back, be sure to press reset button for 5 s to restore dd-wrt's factory defaults *** that's it *** ==Reverting== ===Reverting dd-wrt=== # Download WRH54G firmware from Linksys
# Restore to defaults
# Open upgrade page, select the firmware
# Upgrade
# When it comes back, be sure to press reset button for 5 s to restore Linksys's factory defaults
*** that's it *** ==Pictures==
